reviewText:
Just a quick review for those wondering if they should get it while it's on sale.

So far I am happy with my purchase and recommend it for fans of Match 3 games.  This one kinda reminds me of 4 Elements because you match by clicking, holding down the mouse button, and dragging it through all the gems of the same color that are by each other.  There are occasional hidden object puzzles where you have to find little pieces of an object that are scattered throughout a scene.

There is also some town building.  You get gold after each match 3 level and use it to buy buildings.  There is a choice of 3 different types of buildings with increasing cost.  I don't know what that's all about yet.  So far I've just been choosing the cheapest buildings.  For instance, first you build a house and they give you 3 options of housing.  The more expensive ones have more decoration.  I don't know if they do anything else.

And of course there are power ups in the match 3 levels.  There's a lightning icon that will destroy all the gems and things in a line, sometimes a straight line and sometimes diagonal.  There's rope and stone blocks that need to be destroyed before more gems can fall.  There's a wing icon that reveals hidden parts of the board.  Gems and treasure chests that give you more gold!

I will update as I play more.

reviewText: Beautifully crafted little game. As casual as casual can be. In addition to ripping off many of those casual game staples like hidden objects and match-3, it also offers many interesting ideas to these genres, and has fine level design. The story and setting is very cliché but it can also be endearing. I appreciate the good soundtrack and visuals. Has a few flaws such as levels getting too long for casual gaming, the city builder being just a non-interactive façade, and, I can't believe I'm going to say this: I'd have liked to get more hidden object scenes... Sorry, I'll just be on my way.

reviewText:
By The Gods ,This Game Is Addictive!!
Yeah im really digging this cute little match 3 game !! Its just your basic match 3 game and you use help from the Gods as you progress and unlock them as power ups to aid you on your way to help finish the board.As you play you help rebuild Athens and help its people along the way.There is also some Hidden Object puzzles thrown in also for good measure :)

If you are a fan of fun casual match 3 games get this game ;) Enjoy !!

reviewText: I both liked and despised this game.  The basic gameplay (make trails of 3+ matching tokens to clear them) is entertaining and the minigames like the city building and hidden object screens, while slight, are nice diversions.  But when the level I'm working on completely reconfigures itself, undoing all the work I've done, for the FOURTH time, I got tired of it.  And that was around Sequence 4, of 8.  And then there are the obnoxious design choices like the coins - which you collect to make buildings. Fine and good, except some of the level types that include coins don't actually get counted. There are reasons, but not good enough to justify it.  When levels in a casual game can take 10-15 minutes to complete, and working to get the coins is wasted effort, it makes the game too frustrating to recommend. Casual players may like it for a while, but if you're like me and want to get to the end, you'll be tearing your hair out in frustration.

reviewText: Great Match 3 game with a nice variety in level design and fair difficulty curve. The city-building sim elements and hidden object scenes are a fun diversion if you like that sort of thing, but probably substantial enough to be annoying if you don't.

reviewText:
A light-hearted Match 3 builder game with Greek Mythology elements. You play The Builder who saves Athens from volcanoes and others that try to ruin it.

Pros:
+Very beautiful texture, artwork, and soundtrack.
+You get Both timed and nontimed mode. This is nice because I can up or down the difficulty on my choosing. It gives the player a sense of control.
+The gameplay is pretty fun and the different gods having a powerup(to help clear the board) is a nice bonus.
+Smooth FPS
+It changes the gameplay occasionally to keep it from being monotonous.

Cons:
- My only complaint about this game was the 3.99 price. I would've gladly handed over 5 bucks because the designers deserve it.

Overall:
A well polished game that I can easily pick up and drop. There's no rush and nothing that causes me stress. I would buy this if you into the Match 3 Realm. :)

reviewText: A chain-match match-3 game, with a Greek mythology theme, a minimal city management aspect built in, and the occasional hidden object or other stage thrown in for variety. I actually really enjoyed this for a few reasons, one being that the board is a hex-grid, and not the standard square, leading to more abilities to match, as well as the fact that it also has puzzle-like maps where the goal is to figure out how to get some objects off the board with abilities.\n\nQuite good! Would highly recommend if you like casual titles.

reviewText: Interesting hexagonal match 3 game with a pleasant presentation. Really not much I can say about the game other than that it is a well made casual game with a number of twists on the match 3 formula that make it interesting to play. The later level can drag on a bit, but overall the game is really fun to play. The price is fair as you get a good amount of content, but in a sale it's a no-brainer to pick up :)

reviewText: If you like casual Match 3 (M3) games, then Heroes of Hellas 3: Athens" is for you.  The games
recommended: are just fine.  The story wrapper they use to try to link the games into some more meaningful whole (restoring Athens and then building a palace) could be done away with entirely.  But
hoursPlayed: that doesn't detract from the actual gameplay.  Also
voteText: just for completeness
helpfulPercent: you should know that the M3s have Fractured Object Games (FROGs) and Move Limited Match 3 (MLM3) games interspersed throughout them.  I'm not a fan of FROGs
votesHelpful: but they're only about one every "level" of the main game (there are 8 levels of 13 games (I believe)).  The MLM3s are half of the "bonus" "Build your Palace" portion.\n\nThe game does have some issues
votesFunny: it's an old game and doesn't limit its frame rate.  When I first started it
commentsCount: I noticed my fans ramping up on my graphics card.  When I checked the frame rate
column16: it was over a thousand.  So
column17: I had to install RivaTuner and set up a frame rate limit (60 fps) for the game.  Second
column18: the story around the actual games is really just tacked on and useless.  I'd have been happier with a grid showing games available and games done just like they did in the "bonus" portion where you build your palace.  And
column20: the palace you build in that "bonus" portion is a mess:  it's ugly
column24: it's just a wrapper around the actual games.\n\nBut
column26: I got about 30 hours of good play (24 hours in the main game
column27: 6 hours in the "bonus" game) out of this $3.99 (which I got in a bundle
column28: so the cost was utterly trivial).  If you like M3s
column29: then I recommend this game.  Good value for the money."

reviewText: This does have a relaxed mode so you dont have to worry about beatting the clock. The graphics while a little plain get the job done and the sound is good. The game play is to match 3 tiles and they also offer puzzles every 4 or 5 levels to break up the game play a bit.\n\nYou can also get to build up your town. You can also click on your people to see what they are thinking and also look for rubies inside your town to click on for some more extra money. A fun game.

reviewText:
Das Spiel kann ich jedem Mach 3 Fan nur empfehlen.
Ohne strategische Planung kommt man in einigen Leveln nicht weit, vor allem gilt es die Spezialkräfte der Götter
gut zu nutzen. Nachdem man schließlich das Spiel gewonnen hat, gilt es sogar noch in 30 Bonus-Leveln seinen
eigenen Palast zu errichten. Diese Level sind in normale und Puzzel geteilt. Vor allem die Puzzels in dem man
in vorgegebenen Zügen das Bild klären muß sind dabei interessant.
Aber auch sonst macht es teils einfach nur Spass mal seinen Athenern beim rumwusseln zu zusehen (hier hat es
mir vor allem die Figur, die 3 hin und herwackelnde Töpfe rumträgt angetan).

reviewText: This is a cute little game - as far as chain matching games go, which is the main element of this game.  You're a hero set out to collect gold to rebuild the little town of Anthens. The main screen shows your progress, your people and building options. There's an RPG element, some hidden object levels, puzzles and building task all wrapped up in graphicaly pleasing casual game. Recomemded for those that like this matching games.  (The puzzles get tricky later on in the game but nothing too tough)

reviewText: Heroes of Hellas 3 is primarily a tile-matching game on a hex grid, with a chain-drawing mechanic.  It's not wildly innovative, but it's solid, well-made casual fun for those who like the match-3 style, but want something a little bit differenct from the standard match-3 gameplay.\n\nThe game is padded out with a few scenes of city-building and hidden objects.  These scenes are fluff, add nothing, and should be ignored, but they can usually be dispensed with quickly, so they don't detract too much.  the writing (in English at least) is somewhat clumsy, but you aren't really playing this for the story; you're playing for the actual tile-matching levels, and those are quite satisfying, if not particularly challenging.

reviewText:
This game was super addictive and challenging. It's not enough to match shapes with each other, you have to do legitimate problem solving. Solving a puzzle is fun, and you feel a real sense of accomplishment once you reach the next stage.

Just as importantly, it works on low end hardware. I had no problem running this on my HP Stream which runs on a Celeron processor on 2GB of RAM. And when I output this on a TV through HDMI, it had no problem with the higher resolution, working like a charm. Though this game doesn't officially support it, I found the Steam Controller much more satisfying to use than my laptop trackpad.

The hidden object of the game wasn't as satisfying as the puzzling. Thankfully, there's much much more puzzling than hidden object.

Finally, this is a great game to play with a toddler. My 2-year-old daughter loved watch the shapes match with each other, along with the explosions. She was thoroughly entertained.

Highly recommended!
